concise_definition: n. 农作物, 收成, 产量; v. 剪短, 修剪

definitions.explanation_en: Plants that are grown in large quantities on farms for food, fiber, fuel, or other economic uses, typically harvested seasonally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在农场中大规模种植、用于食物、纤维、燃料或其他经济用途的植物，通常按季节收获。
definitions.example_en: Wheat, corn, and rice are staple crops in many countries.
definitions.example_cn: 小麦、玉米和大米是许多国家的主要农作物。

definitions.explanation_en: The total amount of a particular crop harvested in a single season; the yield or harvest of agricultural produce.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在单个季节内收获的某种农作物的总产量；农业产品的收成。
definitions.example_en: This year's crop of apples was unusually large due to favorable weather.
definitions.example_cn: 由于天气有利，今年苹果的收成异常丰富。

definitions.explanation_en: A group of people or things that appear or are produced at the same time, often used metaphorically to refer to a new generation or cohort.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指同时出现或产生的一群人或事物，常用于比喻新一代或一批人。
definitions.example_en: The new crop of graduates is entering the job market with advanced digital skills.
definitions.example_cn: 这一批新毕业生带着先进的数字技能进入就业市场。

definitions.explanation_en: To cut or trim something, especially hair or fur, short, often for practical or aesthetic reasons.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某物（尤其是头发或毛发）剪短，通常出于实用或美观的考虑。
definitions.example_en: He decided to crop his hair short for the summer.
definitions.example_cn: 他决定把头发剪短以度过夏天。

comparison.analysis: “Harvest” (收获) 强调的是收割或采集农作物的动作或过程，也可以泛指任何收获的成果，侧重于行为本身或结果的获取。而 “crop” 更侧重于指被种植和收获的植物本身，或其总产量，是名词化的产物。
“Yield” (产量) 是一个更抽象的经济或统计术语，指单位面积或单位投入所产出的数量，常用于农业、金融或科学领域。它强调效率和产出率，而 “crop” 更具体，指实际种植的植物种类或收成总量。
“Trim” (修剪) 与 “crop” 作为动词时意义相近，都指剪短，但 “trim” 更常用于精细修饰，如修剪草坪、树枝或发型的边缘，强调美观和细节；而 “crop” 更强调大幅度地剪短，有时甚至接近剃除，语气更粗犷或实用。
